# Data process

## South Africa

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `q1000b`|
|-|-|
| **Label** | `q1000b: contact with:`|
| **Table name** | `southAfricaINDdata` |
| **Categories** |`1 = respondent`|
| | `2 = proxy respondent` |
| | `3 = no one` |
| **Missings** | `8 = don't know` | 
| | `9 = not applicable` | 
| **Description** |  |


```{r assign1, echo=F}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'SAGE_proxy','SAGE.southAfricaINDdata',
                         variables=list('q1000b'), missings = TRUE)
SAGE_proxy <- opal.execute(o,'SAGE_proxy')
```


```{r local1,  echo=FALSE}
vari <- SAGE_proxy[[2]]
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(8, 9))[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(8, 9))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(8, 9))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(SAGE_proxy, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency") 
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `recode 1 "respondent" into 0`
* `recode 2 "proxy respondent" into 1`
* `recode 3 "no one" into 999`
* `recode 8 "DK" into 998`
* `recode 9 "NA" into 996`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo1,   echo=TRUE}
SAGE_SA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=SAGE_proxy$id)
SAGE_SA_ds_w1$proxy <- car::recode(SAGE_proxy[[2]], "1=0; 2=1; 3=999; 8=998; 9=996; NA=999")
SAGE_SA_ds_w1$proxy <- labelled(SAGE_SA_ds_w1$proxy, labels = cat_label)
label(SAGE_SA_ds_w1$proxy) <- ds_label_all
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript1,  echo=FALSE}
vari <- SAGE_SA_ds_w1$proxy
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(SAGE_SA_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(proxy))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")
```


```{r importOPAL1,  echo=FALSE}
proxy <- SAGE_SA_ds_w1
save(proxy, file = "../RData/SA_w1/proxy.RData")
rm(proxy)
```

# Quality estimation
There are two more variables with proxy respondent information: 'Q0003' and 'Q1004'. But we thoung that 'q1000b' is the variable that fit better with the definition of the proxy variable.
